timeline.message:
Add FlattenedArrayObjectSCanner

- Use flattened size when iterating flattened arrays
- Use object ptr in Mixed and Reference scanner constructors

Signed-off-by: Andrew Young <youngar17@gmail.com>

Add FlattenedArrayObjectSCanner

- Use object ptr in Mixed and Reference scanner constructors

timeline.bodyText: I guess typo. Should it be /* megaObject */ ?
timeline.author: dmitripivkine

timeline.bodyText: you can use checkFieldAccessMHOfAssortedType to verify that what you are getting back is the correct thing
timeline.author: tajila

replies.bodyText: I added tests so now we're doing all three singleAlignment, objectAlignment, and longAlignment.  The tests are now using checkFieldAccessMHOfAssortedType on each array element.
replies.author: youngar

timeline.bodyText: For this test we want to see whether the GC will scan the default value on the J9Class (see https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/master/runtime/gc_structs/ValueTypesIterator.hpp#L69), we know this is tested with a big number (200000) does it still exercise that path with 200?
timeline.author: tajila

replies.bodyText: This was accidentally added, the tests were simply taking too long.  Thanks for pointing it out.  Could we switch this test to call System.gc()?
replies.author: youngar

replies.bodyText: I just switched back the number for now.
replies.author: youngar
